model

Class QuizModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Model
      • model.QuizModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class QuizModel
extends Model
    This Model makes an ArrayList of Questions from the animals that were researched and picks one to ask the player
    Author:
    Miguel Fuentes, W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Andre Green
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuizModel(int frameWidth, int frameHeight, java.util.List<Animal> researched, CodeListener listener)
      This calls the super class constructor, makes the question pool, picks a question or creates a scap question if you did not catch any animals

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkAnswer(java.lang.String answer)
      This will check if the answer chosen was correct or not
      Question getQuestion()
      This returns the question that we ask the player
      java.util.Collection<Question> getQuestionPool() 
      Model nextModel()
      This should not be called but if something goes wrong and it is, you will end up with a score of -1
      Model questionAnswered(boolean questionCorrect)
      This is how to transition out of this model, the EndModel that is created will differ if the question was correct or incorrect
      void setQuestionPool(java.util.ArrayList<Question> questionPool)
      This sets questionPool
